summary: This is an internal FBI email chain from October 5, 2020, requesting and approving authority for an FBI Special Agent and an NYPD detective to travel to London to interview a witness in the Jeffrey Epstein and Ghislaine Maxwell investigation. The witness is a UK citizen represented by counsel Jill Greenfield.

persons.name: Paul Byrne
persons.context: NYPD detective who, along with an FBI Special Agent, requested travel to London to conduct interviews for the Epstein investigation.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Subject of the FBI investigation for sexual exploitation and abuse of minors; charged and arrested in July 2019 for sex trafficking and conspiracy.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Co-conspirator investigated for assisting, facilitating, and contributing to Epstein's abuse of minors; charged and arrested in July 2020.

persons.name: Jill Greenfield
persons.context: Counsel representing a witness in London who has information on crimes committed by Epstein and Maxwell.

persons.name: Charles P. Spencer
persons.context: FBI employee who approved the travel authority request in the email chain.

persons.name: John Illia
persons.context: Concurred with the travel request for the FBI and NYPD personnel to London.

connections.description: Maxwell is described as a co-conspirator who assisted, facilitated, and contributed to Epstein's abuse of minors.
Detective Byrne is part of the law enforcement team traveling to investigate crimes related to Epstein.
Jill Greenfield is counsel for a witness who has information on crimes committed by Maxwell and Epstein.

events.title: Epstein Arrest
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein was charged and arrested for sex trafficking and conspiracy.

events.title: Maxwell Arrest
events.description: Ghislaine Maxwell was charged and arrested for enticement of a minor, transportation of a minor, conspiracy, and perjury.

events.title: Approval for London Travel
events.description: FBI approved authority for an SA and NYPD Detective Paul Byrne to travel to London to interview a witness in the Epstein/Maxwell case.

keyFacts: In October 2020, the FBI and NYPD were coordinating to send investigators to London to interview a UK citizen witness in the Epstein/Maxwell case.
The witness was represented by attorney Jill Greenfield and had voluntarily agreed to speak with the FBI with counsel present.
The investigation involved coordination between FBI New York and the Southern District of New York's U.S. Attorney's Office.
Ghislaine Maxwell is explicitly described as a co-conspirator who recruited, groomed, and abused minors for Epstein.
The travel request required high-level approval (AD authority) and involved seeking a quarantine waiver from the U.S. embassy due to pandemic conditions.
